Package sammish93.tbage.models

Class Ability

java.lang.Object
sammish93.tbage.models.Ability
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Useable
public class Ability extends Object implements Useable, Serializable
This class is used as means of giving an Enemy object an alternative option other than a melee attack. An enemy can have multiple abilities in its pool, and an algorithm will run, based on weighted value percentages, and the enemy's isMelee boolean value, along with its melee chance per turn.
See Also:

  • Method Details

    • create

      public static Ability create() throws InvalidValueException
      Returns:
      Returns an initialised Ability object with a default UUID value as a name, and a 50% probability chance for the ability to be chosen on an enemy's turn (weighted probability).
      Throws:
      InvalidValueException - Is thrown if the ability probability is less than or equal to 0, or greater than 1.

    • create

      public static Ability create(String name) throws InvalidValueException
      Parameters:
      name - A string that is used as an identifier for this ability.
      Returns:
      Returns an initialised Ability object with a 50% probability chance for the ability to be chosen on an enemy's turn (weighted probability).
      Throws:
      InvalidValueException - Is thrown if the ability probability is less than or equal to 0, or greater than 1.

    • create

      public static Ability create(String name, double abilityProbabilityPerTurn) throws InvalidValueException
      Parameters:
      name - A string that is used as an identifier for this ability.
      abilityProbabilityPerTurn - A double value greater than 0, and less than or equal to 1. The value 0.5 is equivalent to 50%, while 1 is equivalent to 100%. This probability chance is weighted, and is calculated via the StringParser class.
      Returns:
      Returns an initialised Ability object based on the parameters provided.
      Throws:
      InvalidValueException - Is thrown if the ability probability is less than or equal to 0, or greater than 1.
      See Also:
      • StringParser

    • onUse

      public void onUse(GameEngine gameEngine)
      Specified by:
      onUse in interface Useable
      Parameters:
      gameEngine - The current instance of the GameEngine is required so that the lambda used can reference other dependencies of the GameEngine class such as the player or current encounter.

    • isUseable

      public boolean isUseable()
      Returns:
      Returns true in the event that there is an on-use behavior set that can execute when the onUse() method is called.

    • setOnUseBehaviour

      public void setOnUseBehaviour(Useable useable)
      Parameters:
      useable - Intended to use a lambda to allow developers to create custom behaviours when a specific ability is used. Example of a lambda created using the generic Useable interface: Useable fireballAbility = (gameEngine) -> { var player = gameEngine.getPlayer(); player.subtractFromCurrentHealth(5); gameEngine.printMessage("You have taken 5 damage from a fireball!"); };

    • getOnUseBehaviour

      public Useable getOnUseBehaviour()
      Returns:
      Returns the generic Useable interface if it exists.

    • getName

      public String getName()
      Returns:
      Returns a string representing the name of this object. If no name is set then an UUID converted to a string will be returned.

    • setName

      public void setName(String name)
      Parameters:
      name - Sets the name of this object to a new string value.

    • getAbilityProbabilityPerTurn

      public double getAbilityProbabilityPerTurn()
      Returns:
      Returns a decimal value representing the probability chance of an ability being chosen to be executed during an enemy's turn. This probability chance is weighted, and is calculated via the StringParser class.

    • setAbilityProbabilityPerTurn

      public void setAbilityProbabilityPerTurn(double abilityProbabilityPerTurn) throws InvalidValueException
      Parameters:
      abilityProbabilityPerTurn - A decimal value representing the probability chance of an ability being chosen to be executed during an enemy's turn. The value must be greater than 0, and less than or equal to 1. The value 0.5 is equivalent to 50%, while 1 is equivalent to 100%. This probability chance is weighted, and is calculated via the StringParser class.
      Throws:
      InvalidValueException - Is thrown if the ability probability is less than or equal to 0, or greater than 1.

      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      Returns a string representation of this object. Note that this method is overridden, and not the same as the default implementation.

    • save

      public void save(String path) throws IOException
      Serialises to a local path. The file type extension is '.ser'.
      Parameters:
      path - The location that the .ser file will be saved to, along with the file name. Example: ability.save("src/fileName");
      Throws:
      IOException - Arises if the file path cannot be serialised to.
      InvalidPathException - Arises if the path contains characters other than the English alphabet, underscores, and forward slashes.

    • save

      public void save(String path, String fileExtension) throws IOException
      Serialises to a local path. The file type extension is decided by the developer.
      Parameters:
      path - The location that the .ser file will be saved to, along with the file name. Example: ability.save("src/fileName", "sav");
      fileExtension - The file type extension the developer wishes to save the file as.
      Throws:
      IOException - Arises if the file path cannot be serialised to.
      InvalidPathException - Arises if the path contains characters other than the English alphabet, underscores, and forward slashes.

    • load

      public static Ability load(String path) throws IOException, ClassNotFoundException
      Serialises to a local path. The file type extension is only required when the extension is something other than '.ser'.
      Parameters:
      path - The location that the file is located at. This can either be with or without the file extension. Examples: var ability = Ability.load("src/fileNameWithSavExtension.sav"); or var ability = Ability.load("src/fileNameWithSerExtension");
      Throws:
      IOException - Arises if the file path cannot be serialised to.
      ClassNotFoundException - Arises if the file cannot be deserialised to this class. underscores, and forward slashes.
